item.title: Kafka Streams FK-join within the same KTable
item.description: KTable to KTable foreign-key joins is one of the coolest features in Kafka Streams. I was wondering whether this feature would handle FK-joins between values on the same table. Seems that the answer is yes: var ktable = builder.table("table", Consumed.with(Serdes.String(), Serdes.String())); ktable .join(ktable, s -> s, (v1, v2) -> v1 + "-" + v2) .toStream() .to("fkjoin_v1", Produced.with(Serdes.String(), Serdes.String())); Values will be used as keys.
